query: When to take a chlid to hospital for dengue?
expected_prefix: In children, seek urgent care for persistent vomiting, severe abdominal pain, bleeding, lethargy, difficulty breathing, or signs of dehydration. Children can worsen quickly and need prompt evaluation.
reply: Seek immediate medical care if warning signs appear: severe or persistent abdominal pain, persistent vomiting, bleeding (gums, nose, vomit blood), difficulty breathing, fainting, cold/clammy skin, or sudden weakness. These may indicate severe dengue requiring urgent treatment. (variant 1505)
